title: Access violation in SkyX on Windows with Intel HD Graphics 4600

content.raw:
I’ve built gazebo 9 on windows following the updated instructions on [#!/osrf/gazebo\_tutorials/pull-requests/555/updated-gazebo9-build-tutorial-on-windows](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/555/updated-gazebo9-build-tutorial-on-windows/diff) .

gzserver runs fine, but gzclient crashes on startup.

This might be a driver issue, but I’d like to dig into it to see if there’s anything Gazebo/SkyX can do to at least not end up with a crash.

The stack trace is always the same:

What’s interesting is that the program crashes when loading the PF\_BYTE\_LA texture media/skyx/SkyX\_Moon.png, which is a 16-bit PNG. However, the GPU info above doesn’t show support for PF\_BYTE\_LA. But, when I run gzclient on the same machine within WSL, the MESA driver shows proper support for PF\_BYTE\_LA textures and runs even including SkyX. So the hardware definitely supports the texture format.

So I’d think it can be an issue of my GPU driver, but I have the latest version for my device \(updated in 2018 or 19\). Nevertheless, I think the rendersystem should check if the loaded texture format is supported, and if the GPU tells it’s not, it should at least print out a nice error message about what’s going on and exit cleanly.

If it helps, here’s a RelWithDebInfo crash dump: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hhvGTslXtRpLJvQIzmfV0gmYvg9E\_p2y/view?usp=drivesdk](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hhvGTslXtRpLJvQIzmfV0gmYvg9E_p2y/view?usp=drivesdk) \(I also built OGRE 1.10 as RelWithDebInfo to get the right details\) . You can open it in WinDbg x64, type .ecxr, and show the call stack to examine the stack yourself.
content.html:

gzserver runs fine, but gzclient crashes on startup.

This might be a driver issue, but I’d like to dig into it to see if there’s anything Gazebo/SkyX can do to at least not end up with a crash.

What’s interesting is that the program crashes when loading the PF_BYTE_LA texture media/skyx/SkyX_Moon.png, which is a 16-bit PNG. However, the GPU info above doesn’t show support for PF_BYTE_LA. But, when I run gzclient on the same machine within WSL, the MESA driver shows proper support for PF_BYTE_LA textures and runs even including SkyX. So the hardware definitely supports the texture format.

So I’d think it can be an issue of my GPU driver, but I have the latest version for my device (updated in 2018 or 19). Nevertheless, I think the rendersystem should check if the loaded texture format is supported, and if the GPU tells it’s not, it should at least print out a nice error message about what’s going on and exit cleanly.

If it helps, here’s a RelWithDebInfo crash dump: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hhvGTslXtRpLJvQIzmfV0gmYvg9E_p2y/view?usp=drivesdk (I also built OGRE 1.10 as RelWithDebInfo to get the right details) . You can open it in WinDbg x64, type .ecxr, and show the call stack to examine the stack yourself.
